website_summaries.verdict: The best training baseball available. Set ships with two different weighted balls for drills.
pros: One ball in the set weighs 10 ounces, while second ball weighs 12 ounces
Each weight has a different color (yellow and black) so you can clearly differentiate them from standard baseballs
Designed for special drills aimed at building arm strength for throwing
cons: Improper use or overuse could lead to arm injuries or soreness

customer_reviews.title: Great Training!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for training. We use the yellow ball for right now; haven't used the black, heavier ball yet. I throw this back and forth with my 10 year old after doing a session of long toss with a regular baseball. After finishing the heavy ball training, then we go straight to mound practice with a regular baseball. Over a few sessions we have already noticed a slight velocity increase. Be careful when starting with heavy ball training and start at a low number of throws, working your way up. As long as it isn't overdone, these can add a great addition to your pitching training.
customer_reviews.author: Just_Another_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weighted Balls
customer_reviews.text: They are what they are...weighted balls. I do agree with what another reviewer said on here...it's probably not a good idea to make a ball that you're going to be throwing around black in color. Makes it hard to trace at dusk.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A great way to warm up your arm before a game
customer_reviews.text: A great way to warm up your arm before a game. I spend about 10 minutes tossing one of these balls to loosen up my shoulder -- old guy playing baseball. Get's my arm loose in about half the time. Note: You really have to focus on mechanics with these balls. Keep the shoulder over your elbow or you'll be flirting with some arm pain/damage. Definitely wouldn't buy these for a little leaguer -- way too much chance of arm damage.
customer_reviews.author: NKY Ballplayer

customer_reviews.title: Build strength in those young arms!
customer_reviews.text: Size of a standard baseball but with additional weight to build arm strength. Help them build confidence in their arm to make any throw on the field.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan F.

customer_reviews.title: He loved these and says he actually feels the difference in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my brother who is now 17 and pitches for varsity baseball at his school. He loved these and says he actually feels the difference in strength he has gotten from throwing these around. People say that these balls are damaging to throw but if you throw them with correct form they are no more harmful than the throwing motion of an unweighted ball. would highly recommend to anyone looking to increase speed or velocity of their throw!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and useful. The 12oz is quite heavy though
customer_reviews.text: Well made and useful. The 12oz is quite heavy though. It's good for arm exercises before throwing though.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: The balls are a great tool for arm strengthening and warming up. My 10yo has been using them for a while and his throwing speed has really increased. It's always funny to see him throw a regular baseball after warming up with the increased weight of the SKLZ ball.
customer_reviews.author: Total Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: SKLZ weighted baseballs are very good and they last
customer_reviews.text: SKLZ weighted baseballs are very good and they last... Like in years... I highly recommend this product... PS there is a place for overload training...
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Used before every game
customer_reviews.text: My son warms up with these before he goes out to pitch.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fearby

customer_reviews.title: Pitching practice must have
customer_reviews.text: These weighted baseballs are great for pitching practice. I love having two different weights to choose from. Our eight year old has been using the lighter of the two balls but will graduate to the heavier one when he is a little older.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: They look nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a while back. I actually thought I was buying softballs. They ended up in storage after because of a move. I just found them.... anyone want to buy them or can I exchange?
customer_reviews.author: Kenji tokunaga

customer_reviews.title: Use before pitching
customer_reviews.text: We play catch with these balls about 10-15 each at a short distance before pitching. When he does get on the mound after throwing these the baseball seems really light
customer_reviews.author: BOOG

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Has helped my sons through further and faster. great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eladio Nieves Jr

customer_reviews.title: I'm about to buy a few more because I have been happy with them
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kid that is having trouble getting his throws down .... try these. If you have a kid that is having trouble swinging through the ball... try these. The only knock is the ball surface - slippery. It will take a few minutes to rough it up. Despite that, I'm about to buy a few more because I have been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: KingMirob

customer_reviews.title: Wow these are great for helping with swing strength
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are great for helping with swing strength. They are a bit hard to pitch well but after you can master this the change in batting power is pretty noticeable. My son has been using these and he now follows through a swing with better consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Grover

customer_reviews.title: You don’t just throw them.
customer_reviews.text: They are great IF YOU KNOW HOW TO USE THEM. Good way to use them is to just toss them 90ft as a lob toss. Or you can throw it right to a fence 5-10ft away. Just don’t use all your power. It’s not just weighted balls. Bands and streatching are also needed if you want to throw harder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what i needed
customer_reviews.text: perfect for what i needed. do not throw on cement or bounce the ball. Best used for a slow warm up on grass.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Great practice tools!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these heavy balls for my 9 year old. We have used them throughout the spring and summer so far. I have seen the improvements in his arm strength. He can now throw from 3rd to 1st with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: BrewMan7

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter. We’re very helpful in her training for the upcoming season.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Bray

customer_reviews.title: may be good for a baseball player but I needed the softball ...
customer_reviews.text: wrong product. sent back. may be good for a baseball player but I needed the softball weighted balls
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Heard

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a baseball coach and these weighted balls are a good way to increase throwing power. They are well constructed and durable. I would recommend for someone looking to throw harder.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lynn Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool and good price!
customer_reviews.text: Baseballs are leather wrapped so they'll hold up for a while. The weights are great for a younger (13-15) and older (16+) group. My son has seen a noticeable improvement in speed after doing proper drills with these. I would definitely recommend again.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Ump

customer_reviews.title: Weighted Balls Worthy Purchase
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my young, 10-year-old MBA-hopeful. He loves them. Be careful how use them though. If you're catching them, they can hit the glove like a ton of bricks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great for the price. I play adult league baseball currently and weighted balls are one of my favorite ways to get my arm loose and build arm strength (be careful). They are plasticy but that was what I was expecting the seems still feel great and if dropped and scuffed them up over the last couple weekends to tell you that they are relatively durable. At this price I dont know what more anyone would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Hamilton Gordon Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good product, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Good product for a decent price. Only bad thing was opening it. The plastic was very hard to open and the baseballs were hard to get out. Get new packaging! Also part of packaging was damaged. But product still is good.
customer_reviews.author: Nat Kerp

customer_reviews.title: throw, throw, throw your ball, gently down the field
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kid who's training to be a pitcher, these things are off the schizzle. Just bewared, you probably should wear a catcher's mitt when playing catch with these bad boys, otherwise you're hand will look like raw meat. Baseball been berry berry good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McLarnon

customer_reviews.title: Tore
customer_reviews.text: One baseball tore during first use. Hopefully replacement last longer. Otherwise baseball seem helpful for training
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent weight training for developing young pitchers. I only wish I had these when I first started playing baseball. This product is really well made and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: CabinFever

customer_reviews.title: Good value and priced correctly
customer_reviews.text: Good value and priced correctly. Others want a high margin on these items but I only paid $10 for these two balls. Paying $20 or $30 for them is a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Leon

customer_reviews.title: Seem like good quality baseballs just heavier
customer_reviews.text: Seem like good quality baseballs just heavier. Definitely would not hit and only throw for a short while to build strength.
customer_reviews.author: D. Viti

customer_reviews.title: Two good weights
customer_reviews.text: I have used both balls now and they are perfects weights for early throwing and building arm strength. The balls are constructed with quality covers and were worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alberty

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with these weighted balls
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with these weighted balls. My 8 yr old loves them. We'll warm up with reg. ball for 15 min. or so then 15 to 20 minutes with weighted ball and then 5 to 10 min. with reg. ball. It really gives your arm a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Tazman

customer_reviews.title: Great stitching. The only downside to the ball which ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described. Great stitching. The only downside to the ball which I do not give it 5 stars is because the balls are made of a slick material.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: affordable training device
customer_reviews.text: Priced right and a nice way to build some arm strength and pitch speed. Can sting if caught wrong and not for unsupervised use by younger players, but used correctly a nice addition to the training toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Helps to build arm strength
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good for training, two different weighted balls allows you to alernate long toss distances.definately notice a speed increase in fastball
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine Harding

customer_reviews.title: Every youth coach should own these.
customer_reviews.text: Great on building and working arm strength. I use these during the one knee throwing drill, not distance but rather form and strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great strengthening tool. We warm up and then do light toss with the 10 oz, go back to a baseball (5oz) and then finish up with the 12oz. Just be careful as these will leave a mark if your kid can't catch.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddyDeath

customer_reviews.title: Weighted Balls
customer_reviews.text: These are just as advertised. Same size as a regular baseball, they just weigh more. I play catch with my 10 year old for short durations. I'm don't want him to pull or strain anything. I use them with caution. Good product
customer_reviews.author: zodia

customer_reviews.title: Quality is disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed that the first time my son used this ball it ripped. I threw out the packaging so I don't think I can return them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for strengthening the arm
customer_reviews.text: Got this to strengthen the arm of my 9 year old left handed boy. Just be careful when switching to the real Baseball. It will feel lighter so just play soft catch until the zone is acquired.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for the purpose...don't let it hit hard objects though...it will damage the outer layer

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed at all
customer_reviews.text: I got what I expected. Not disappointed at all! Son loves practicing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Capps

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most effective way to increase throw speed. I've been using gow about a week and gained speed and accuracy exponentially. I use 12 ounce for normal catch and 10 ounce for long ball. (of your arm isnt strong enough, dont use it! Risk of injury can be high).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for playing catch in the backyard
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr-old started pitching this year and I bought these thinking it should help him with velocity, but it also helped with his confidence. Still using the 10oz yellow ball but expect him to them the 12oz black ball this summer during his off season. I think it is an excellent buy

customer_reviews.title: They love them and are gaining the benefits as they use ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boys, 8 and 6 years old. They love them and are gaining the benefits as they use them.

customer_reviews.title: Effective at increasing throwing speed and distance in junior players!
customer_reviews.text: Using to build arm strength to increase throwing speed of my son. Very effective at not only increasing speed, but also accuracy. Just remember to not over use the weighted balls.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good item for building arm strength and increasing throw length

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for the buck - these are good for training
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Any way he thinks he pitches better and has been throwing a little harder so he's ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my 9 year old he only uses the heaviest one to warm up before games , probably didn't need the other one . Any way he thinks he pitches better and has been throwing a little harder so he's happy so am I .
customer_reviews.author: cooper f

customer_reviews.title: Now it has a better grip. Can't touch the price
customer_reviews.text: Just sanded the outside cover to get it a rough surface. Now it has a better grip. Can't touch the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great product for training
customer_reviews.text: Great product for training. Try throwing the 10Oz ball for 15 mins, and then try the regular baseball, and you will feel the difference immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeyedoc-Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Good training tool
customer_reviews.text: The 10 oz yellow ball is good to throw prior to warming up with a regular ball, but I'd be careful with it. It puts added pressure on your shoulder, so you need to focus on form and not overthrowing. After 20-25 throws with the weighted ball, a regular ball feels like a whiffle ball. Haven't used the 12 oz. ball yet. Maybe when my son is older, but at 12 years old, the 10 oz is plenty heavy enough. I'd rather they sold them separately for a cheaper price, but at $11.99, it's not like it's that cost-prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxson

customer_reviews.title: Helps your throwing
customer_reviews.text: My arm gets sore if I use these for too long so they must be working.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These balls are great for warming up, and also for improving arm strength. I would recommend them to anyone asking.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Builds your arm strength easily.
customer_reviews.text: We have an aspiring pitcher who needs to build his arm strength. These seem to be helping.

customer_reviews.title: warm up balls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great training aid for my son
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great training aid for my son. He is on smaller side for his age and needs some help to strengthen his arm. He also loves to use this ball to warm up his arm before games.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: great pitching tool
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating because it is a great tool for pitchers wanting to loosen up before any game. After warming up with one of the balls it makes the regular ball for the game seem very light. Great product to use for baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Barraza Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Read instructions of how to use. Already has improved my son's fastball.

customer_reviews.title: Improve arm strength
customer_reviews.text: Great for improving throwing. I have been using with son for a few weeks and seeing results.

customer_reviews.title: Son enjoys throwing with these prior to baseball practice or ...
customer_reviews.text: Son enjoys throwing with these prior to baseball practice or a game to get loosened up. Worth the purchase!

customer_reviews.title: Hmm..
customer_reviews.text: Yeah these weighted balls are pretty cool, just don't throw as hard as you can with it or else you will suffer from shoulder pains....
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Uriah Aaron

customer_reviews.title: They are great and her pitching has gotten a lot faster and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my girl so we can practice her pitching for softball. They are great and her pitching has gotten a lot faster and more accurate. I know they are baseballs but they still work. A+
customer_reviews.author: Dougie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Throwing Arm Power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew. He's playing Little League ball and I thought this would help him build up his throwing arm. It's winter here so he really hasn't had a chance to use it much. I don't see why it wouldn't help him. So for now I'm giving it 5 stars. If I need to update it and lower my rating I'll edit it once the season gets started.
customer_reviews.author: THEBUTLERDIDIT

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was on time and the balls worked great! It was amazing to feel the difference once you've warmed up using at least one of the weighted balls, it makes a regular baseball feel like a tennis ball!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Blume

customer_reviews.title: Great for strengthening your throwing arm
customer_reviews.text: These weighted baseballs are awesome. Great for warming up and makes throwing a regular baseball feel like throwing a styrofoam ball. My son and I use it to help strengthen our arms, throwing longer and longer distances before switching to a regular baseball. We primarily use the 12 oz. baseball, but the 10 oz. works as well and might be better for younger players (maybe 12 and under).
customer_reviews.author: Brian Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Great for the ARM!
customer_reviews.text: These weighted softballs are great for warming up! I play softball and use these to loosen up and a softball feels like its not even there. It has worked great to strengthen the shoulder and throwing arm. A great seller and comes recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Droz

customer_reviews.title: The concept of this product is great and my son has noticed it has helped with ...
customer_reviews.text: The concept of this product is great and my son has noticed it has helped with arm strength to just play catch with them. My only complaint which kept me from a 5 star review is the cheesy covering. They are somewhat slick and the stitching is so tight that they don't feel much like a real baseball. The material also has a strong smell, like real rubber tires (or those black rubber batting tees). I would recommend that they make these with a real leather cover with standard stitching (not too tight) and this product would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: David McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent ! No issues at all. I would recommend this item to any little league pitcher or just kids wanting to strengthen their arm..
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good product, as advertised. It's nice to have the 10oz too, as most people usually just have the heaviest weighted ball (12oz.) P.S. Be careful who you warm up with when using these. I was throwing the 12oz with a teammate and dude fired the ball from about 50ft. away and broke the webbing of a fairly new glove. Wasn't the fault of the ball, but you may catch one in the chops if you're using an old glove.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Griswald

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Kids have been using them and I can already tell the difference. Had a couple of parents asking about them..
customer_reviews.author: KKMARINO

customer_reviews.title: Really good purchase, use them for warm ups and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good purchase , use them for warm ups and it's a real difference between throwing these and a regular baseball .
customer_reviews.author: Jerry ortega

customer_reviews.title: 10 year old grandson loved these balls
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is a very serious baseball player, among other sports. He was delighted to get these weighted balls as he is entering a training program to improve his pitching ability. He and his coach believe these weighted balls to be a top training tool to improve his ball control and increase his speed.
customer_reviews.author: Lin H.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great just might be slightly different that major league baseball Great Results BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Mason Baker

customer_reviews.title: But that said the 10oz'r is great. Wears the kid (and the Dad) out
customer_reviews.text: I wish they gave you the option of only the 10oz. I think we will loose the 12oz'r before he is old enough to use it. But that said the 10oz'r is great. Wears the kid (and the Dad) out...but I think it will make a real difference.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to strength train with my son. He worked hard and has shown real improvement. So much so his coach asked what we were using.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A. Cutshall

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We are working on pitching and it build strength in the arms throwing heavier ball then going back to regular ball it is lighter and helping him get momentum!
customer_reviews.author: sonictea

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for warm ups
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't use these for a lot of throws, however good grip and still looks new. May not be your standard baseball skin but for this kind of ball you don't need it. You just need a few throws to get going and it to last. Can't complain about the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D.

customer_reviews.title: It makes a regular baseball feel like it's nothing
customer_reviews.text: A must use product for me before practice. It makes a regular baseball feel like it's nothing. Too bad my accuracy is still among the worst in my league.
customer_reviews.author: SawBo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Sklz makes the best training products. My son always warms up with one of these balls. It's also strengthening his throwing arm.
customer_reviews.author: Carrlos

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Send to a friend as a gift, he likes it, still has no chance to play with, but the balls are good looking and heavy enough
customer_reviews.author: wenbin dong

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to build up a kids arm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great training tool. These are weighted baseballs which are significantly heavier than a normal baseball. What I like about this product is that it helps build up arm strength and speed, by throwing the ball and playing catch. Something that baseball players normally do. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Pincher

customer_reviews.title: Great for Arm Strength
customer_reviews.text: My son has been working as a catcher and using these weighted baseballs has improved his arm strength. He is now able to make a solid (on-the-line) throw from catcher to second base against base runners.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I received the 10 ounce training ball that had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the 10 ounce training ball that had a large tear at the seem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a while ago. In fact the balls fell apart so quickly, I forgot I purchased them and never wrote a review. I was disgusted with the way they held up. I guess it is possible I had defective balls, but I am not so sure. I am looking at purchasing the multicolored, multi ball set, but am hesitant because I don't want to get another defective set of baseballs. I bought them to use for winter practices last year and was hoping I would still have them for this season...too bad.
customer_reviews.author: mark hefel

customer_reviews.title: Just ingenius, a heavy black baseball
customer_reviews.text: Yellow ball is great, but not sure who the genius was in the SKLZ engineering department that decided BLACK was a great color for a ball that is 2.5x as heavy as a normal baseball? How about red or orange? Guys? Hello? Legal team?
customer_reviews.author: HockeyCentral

customer_reviews.title: FOR JR...
customer_reviews.text: I FEEL THIS WILL AND IS A GOOD ITEM HELPING DEVELOPMENT OF MY CHILDREN ARMS AND BUILD UP MORE STRENGTH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Altovyes C. Mitchell, Sr.

customer_reviews.text: My 10year old was pretty one for them. They were heavy. With time I think he will learn to use them more.

customer_reviews.title: Weighted Baseballs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who says they are exactly what he was looking for.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for training
customer_reviews.text: Great for strengthening arm. Just make sure you know how to use these or you can end up with torn shoulder.

product_meta.title: SKLZ Weighted Training Baseballs, 10 Ounce and 12 Ounce, 2 Pack (Old Model)
product_meta.description:
Weighted baseball training builds throwing and pitching strength. Weighted Baseballs come in a 2-ball set that includes a 10 oz. (yellow) and 12 oz. (black) weighted baseball. Same size, construction and materials as an official baseball. Training drills included.

AMAZON.COM
Weighted baseball training builds throwing and pitching strength. SKLZ Weighted Baseballs come in a 2-ball set that includes a 10 ounce yellow and 12 ounce black weighted baseball that are the same size, construction and material as an official 5 ounce baseball. These balls are ideal for pre-game warmups and building arm strength. 

 Features: 

 * Includes two weighted baseballs; 10 ounce and 12 ounce 
 * Colored yellow and black so you can tell them apart from regulation baseballs 
 * Ideal for building throwing and pitching strength 
 * Same construction as an official baseball with raised seams 
 * Great for pre-game warm ups 
 * Build arm strength by playing catch with a partner or a SKLZ Pitchback Net 
 * Circumference: 9 inches (standard baseball size)
feature_bullets: Heavy standard-sized baseballs build greater throwing and pitching strength
Same construction and materials as an official baseball
2-pack includes 10 oz. (yellow) and 12 oz. (black) weighted balls
Use for training or pre-game warm up
9" balls have real raised seams and leather cover
